summary: This bill, the DETERRENCE Act, aims to enhance sentences for various federal crimes when they are directed by or coordinated with foreign governments. It amends sections of Title 18 of the United States Code related to kidnapping, murder-for-hire, influencing federal officials, stalking, protecting federal officers and employees, and presidential assassination, kidnapping, and assault. The amendments specify sentence increases tied to the involvement of foreign governments or their agents, increasing penalties significantly in a number of circumstances, dependent on the type and severity of harm caused by the crime.
